level.text: As used in this chapter, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed:

Academic year – an equivalent to four hundred and fifty (450) hours of classroom instruction over two (2) semesters of approximately fifteen (15) weeks or three (3) semesters of approximately ten (10) weeks.
Applicant – a person applying for a license to practice acupuncture under this chapter.
Board – the Board of Medicine, established by § 203(a) of the Act, D.C. Code § 2-3302.3 (a) (1988).
Committee – the Advisory Committee on Acupuncture, established by § 203(b) of the Act, D.C. Code § 2-3302.3(b) (1988).
Contact hour – sixty (60) minutes spent by an apprentice under the direct supervision of a preceptor who is either discussing or observing the apprentice’s practice.
Physician – a person licensed to practice medicine under the Act, including an osteopath.
The definitions in § 4099 of chapter 40 of this title are incorporated by reference into and are applicable to this chapter.
